definition: to bestow (a reward)/to give (to an inferior)/to hand down/a reward (bestowed by a superior)/to appreciate (beauty)

sentences.english: or read to him some of my own writings and been rewarded in return with praise unsparing.
sentences.chinese: 或者給他讀些我寫的作品，都得到了他極大的讚賞。

sentences.english: Joint Communiqués on its support of the one China policy.
sentences.chinese: 我們讚賞美國一貫表示支持一箇中國的政策。

sentences.english: Li expressed his appreciations for Vanuatu's stance of adhering to the one-China principle.
sentences.chinese: 曾慶紅對瑙魯堅持一箇中國政策表示讚賞。

sentences.english: Wu expressed appreciation and thanks for this.
sentences.chinese: 吳邦國對此表示讚賞和感謝。

sentences.english: We definitely appreciate the direction that the NYT is taking.
sentences.chinese: 我們絕對讚賞紐約時報的這一發展方向。

sentences.english: Your inquiries will be always highly appreciated and replied within 24 hours.
sentences.chinese: 您的垂詢將始終高度讚賞，並回答了24個小時。

sentences.english: The human desire for recognition starts early .
sentences.chinese: 人類對讚賞的渴求早已有之。

sentences.english: Each complimented an aspect of a woman's body or appearance.
sentences.chinese: 每種均要讚賞女性身體或者外貌的不同方面。

sentences.english: The quality of being deceitful; falseness.
sentences.chinese: 沒有人會讚賞狡獪的人。

sentences.english: Guangwu deep appreciation and gratuities three hundred thousand.
sentences.chinese: 光武帝深表讚賞，又賞錢三十萬。

sentences.english: The Central Government hereby expresses its satisfaction and appreciation for the remarkable achievements that you have made.
sentences.chinese: 中央政府對你們取得的顯著政績，表示滿意和讚賞。

sentences.english: Want to be in the wine on the table to get the appreciation of all, we must learn to read.
sentences.chinese: 要想在酒桌上得到大家的讚賞，就必須學會察言觀色。

sentences.english: Enthusiastic cheers expressed their appreciation of the performance.
sentences.chinese: 熱烈的喝采表達了他們對演出的讚賞。

sentences.english: Admiring it and adding noughts in vain.
sentences.chinese: 讚賞着它，徒勞地做着零與零的加法。

sentences.english: China highly appreciates the positive contribution made by H.E. Pfirter.
sentences.chinese: 中方對菲爾特閣下做出的積極貢獻表示高度讚賞。

sentences.english: Her latest novel was received with great eclat.
sentences.chinese: 她最新的小說備受讚賞。

definition: to praise/to approve of/to show approval
to approve of/to endorse/to acknowledge/to recognize/to identify oneself with
to pay attention to/to follow sth closely/to follow (on social media)/concern/interest/attention
to like/to love/to be fond of/favorite
to attach importance to sth/to value
to repay a favor/to give back/feedback
to be concerned about/to care about
not only (this one)/not just (...) but also
